p: Decoctions and infusions from the aerial parts of Nepeta species have been used in traditional and folk medicines as antioxidant, anticonvulsant, tonic, antipyretic, antitussive, sedative, antiasthmatic, antispasmodic and anti-inflammatory medicines [ 4, 5]. Some of these therapeutic actions were recently comprehensively reviewed [ 6] and received a modern pharmacological validation [ 7, 8, 9].
